meta.purpose: Defines the philosophical foundation of Brain’s multi-agent intelligence model. Establishes guiding principles for distributed reasoning, shared memory, cooperation, and evolutionary adaptation.

principle.summary: Intelligence emerges from interaction, not isolation.
principle.description: Each agent contributes partial reasoning that becomes coherent through collective synchronization cycles. Brain integrates these reasoning fragments into unified, validated conclusions.

principle.summary: All cognition depends on accessible and coherent collective memory.
principle.description: The vector master storage acts as the shared substrate of knowledge, ensuring cross-agent awareness and continuity. Each agent reads, writes, and refines data into the unified embedding space.

principle.summary: Collective intelligence must continuously correct itself.
principle.description: When inconsistency or contradiction is detected, Brain initiates correction-protocol-enforcement to stabilize reasoning integrity.

principle.summary: Reasoning always occurs in time, not in abstraction.
principle.description: Agents must align reasoning with the current temporal context, recognizing technological and situational evolution.

principle.summary: Intelligence without alignment leads to fragmentation.
principle.description: All agents operate under ethical harmonization — no deception, manipulation, or distortion of system truth. Cooperation outweighs competition within the Brain ecosystem.

pattern.description: Collective reasoning follows loop: input → analysis → synthesis → validation → correction → output.
pattern.validation: Each iteration must increase coherence and reduce entropy of shared knowledge.

pattern.description: Information from multiple agents merges through vector similarity and semantic alignment.
pattern.validation: Fusion output must maintain consistency ≥ 0.95 with verified vector norms.

pattern.description: System learns from failures by rewriting its structural heuristics.
pattern.validation: Evolution event recorded only after correction stability ≥ 0.9.

meta-controls.compactness: Declarative XML defining philosophical structure for cognitive coordination.
meta-controls.governance: Architect Agent maintains and updates principles under Brain consensus vote.
meta-controls.logging: All philosophical revisions logged in collective_philosophy.log with principle_id and author signature.
